result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Anthony Standifer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Ltr from DOC requesting Court to review sentence credit granted in sentencing hrg on revocation hrg on 1/15/19.

10:46 AM Defendant Nicholas Anthony Standifer in court with attorney Ronald K Colwell.   Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms counsel received revocation order and warrant and reviewed with his client with no corrections.  State's sentencing comments; DOC recommends 12 mos. in the PCJ and has 163 days jail credit; his criminal history is lengthy; been in trouble with the law since 2008; had mutiple probations; the recommendation doesn't protect the public, heavy handed sentence would be sentence to prison.  Atty Colwell think recommendation appropriate of 12 mos.  Court advises defendant of right of allocution.  Defendant addresses the court.  Court sentences defendant to 12 mos. in the PCJ concurrent to other charges in revocation order and warrant packet with 163 days credit.  Costs previously waived.  Advised of appeal rights.  Atty Colwell asks court if can serve in Eau Claire County.  Court grants request if at no cost to Pepin County.
Delivered to PCSD
Sentencing hearing on revocation on January 15, 2019 at 10:30 am.
Atty Ronald Colwell appt'd.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Nicholas Anthony Standifer in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 2 yrs. probation concurrent with EC; no ordering conditional jail as he's taking positive steps and served @ 5 mos.; no possession or consumption of alcohol; no entrance into bars or taverns w/o advanced written perm. of P&P; comply with any assessment or counseling required by P&P; waive costs due to the $45,000 restitution ordered in EC; provide a DNA sample, stop at the jail today; advised of appeal rights.
Sentencing hearing on June 26, 2017 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Nicholas Anthony Standifer in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Adam C Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel informs court of resolution, defendant will plead to count 2, count 1 DRI.  Off record to complete PLQ.

Defendant Nicholas Anthony Standifer in court with attorney Matthew Krische.  Adam C Sticht appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charge in count 2/max penalties.  Defendant enters plea of no contest. PLQ/WOR form  filed with the court and reviewed with defendant. Court advises defendant of his rights and felony prohibitions.  Defendant is a citizen of US; counsel agrees sufficient facts to support charge and sufficient facts to support prior conviction.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and plea done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty; DRI count 1; dismiss 16FO42.  Any conditions of bond if any are cont'd.  Referred to JA for sentencing hrg.  Defendant updates address:  1315 Cornell St., Eau Claire, WI 54703.

Jury Trial Scheduling Order:
1.  Trial of this matter is set for jury trial on July 17, 2017.  Time allowed for trial is one day.
2.  The District Attorney will send the Defense Atty their settlement offer prior to the FPT.
3.  The Defense Atty shall review the DA's settlement offer with his/her client prior to the FPT.
4.  A FPT is set for June 19, 2017 at 1:00 p.m.
5.  The Defense Atty, the Defendant, and the District Atty shall all personally appear at the FPT.
Failure of the Defendant to appear personally at the FPT shall result in the cancellation of the trial date and a warrant being issued for the defendant's arrest.
6.  All motions shall be filed in writing and no later than April 13, 2017. ....
If a motion is filed, the filing attorney shall contact the Court and obtain a pretrial motion hearing date.
Notices of alibi and responses shall follow the time limits and other requirements of Sec. 971.23(8) Wis. Stats.
7.  If either side intends to offer expert testimony..., such party shall give written notice to the court and opposing counsel no later than April 13, 2017, of the name, address and qualifications of the expert, the opinions which will be solicited from such expert and the basis for those opinions. .... 
For complete Order see file.
